Detailed Description

The base class for every pseudo instruction. Pseudo-instructions represents the code that a task executes. An instruction is identified by an execution time (possibly random) and by a certain optional functionality.

A task contains a list of instructions, that are executed in sequence.

See Also
Task.
Todo:
Implement labels, and non-sequential constructs.

void callEndRun ( )
staticinherited

The same as callNewRun(), but it is called at the end of every run.

See Also
callEndRun

Definition at line 89 of file entity.cpp.

void callNewRun ( )
staticinherited

Returns the pointer to the entity with the specified name or NULL if such entity does not exists. Recursively calls newRun() on every entity in the system. It is automatically called at the beginning of every run by the Simulation class. Not to be called by the user!! In a future release will be hidden.

See Also
callNewRun

Definition at line 69 of file entity.cpp.

virtual void deschedule ( )
pure virtual

Called when the instruction is descheduled.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, SchedInstr, and ActInstr.

virtual void endRun ( )
pure virtual

Reset the entity status at the end of every run. This function is called automatically at the end of every run, and its job consists in resetting the entity status (for example closing files, etc.) Warning: in endRun() is not permitted to create/destroy new entity objects.

Implements Entity.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ActInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, and SchedInstr.

virtual Tick getDuration ( ) const
pure virtual

Returns the total computation time of the instruction

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, SchedInstr, and ActInstr.

virtual Tick getExecTime ( ) const
pure virtual

Returns how long the instrucion has been executed from the last reset().

NOTE: the resetExecdTime is now implicit!!!!

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, SchedInstr, and ActInstr.

Returns the worst-case execution time for this instruction.

virtual void newRun ( )
pure virtual

Resets the entity status at the beginning of every run. This function is called automatically at the beginning of every run, and its job consists in initializing the entity status. Warning: in newRun() is not permitted to create/destroy new entity objects.

Implements Entity.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ActInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, and SchedInstr.

Called upon the instruction end event

virtual void refreshExec ( double  oldSpeed,
double  newSpeed 
)
pure virtual

It refreshes the state of the executing instruction when a change of the CPU speed occurs.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ActInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, and SchedInstr.

virtual void reset ( )
pure virtual

This method permits to kill a task which is currently executing. It resets the internal state of the executing instruction.

This is currently used only by the fault-tolerant scheduling algorithms.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ActInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, and SchedInstr.

virtual void schedule ( )
pure virtual

Called when the instruction is scheduled.

Implemented in SignalInstr, WaitInstr, ExecInstr, ThreInstr, SchedInstr, and ActInstr.
